lesson.title: Be An Elephant Detective
lesson.sentence: Wrinkly gray skin, a huge body, a seven-foot nose. Elephants all seem to look the same. But there are two different kinds of elephants—African and Asian. Each kind is named for the place where it lives in the wild. If you learn a few things to look for, you can tell whether an elephant is African or Asian. An easy way to tell African and Asian elephants apart is to first look at an elephant’s ears. An African elephant has large ears that flap like wings. An Asian elephant has much smaller, rounded ears. Next, look at the elephant’s head. The top of an African elephant’s head is rounded. But an Asian elephant’s head has two bumps on it. If the elephant does not have tusks, it is a female Asian. Finally, check out the elephant’s body. If the back dips down in the middle, it is an African elephant. The back of an Asian elephant is humped. If the two kinds of elephants stood side by side, the African elephant would be much larger.

test.sentence: How are the two kinds of elephants alike
answer: They both have very long noses

card_data.text_en: They both have small, rounded ears
card_data.value: They both have small, rounded ears

card_data.text_en: They both have very long noses

card_data.value: They both have backs that dip down.

test.sentence: Which of these is a difference between african and asian elephants

card_data.text_en: African elephants have rounded backs, but asian elephants do not
card_data.value: African elephants have rounded backs, but asian elephants do not

card_data.text_en: All asian elephants have tusks, but african elephants do not.
card_data.value: All asian elephants have tusks, but african elephants do not.

test.sentence: Which one describes asian elephants but not african elephants
answer: Their ears are small and rounded.

card_data.text_en: They are named for where they live
